description.narrative: By 2015, all rural districts of Mozambique have community health workers trained and deployed to provide essential maternal, newborn and child health services.

sector.narrative: Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
HSS - Health sector policy, planning and governance at national or sub-national levels
IMNCI / Integrated Community Case Management (iCCM) - Community
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2015, all rural districts of Mozambique have community health workers trained and deployed to provide essential maternal, newborn and child health services.

description.narrative: With UNICEF support, the community health worker programme was scaled-up in terms of total number of CHWs deployed and breadth of the service package for women and child. In 2016 the programme shifted focus to address remaining barriers of unequal distribution and quality leveraging mHealth technology. | Status:Met | As-of Date:19/01/2017

title.narrative: % of children U5 with ARI symptoms who receive antibiotics

actual.value: 2016:There is no updated data specific to ARI. The most recent household survey (IMASIDA 2015) measured the treatment for diarrhoea and malaria, finding 46%, 36% of child with related symptoms received treatment (ORS, anti-malaria).

title.narrative: Community Health Workers trained to implement integrated community case management (% of actually trained against the planned)
% of districts with trained CHWs and implementing community case management

actual.value: 2016:All targeted districts of Mozambique have trained CHWs implementing integrated community case management (iCCM) = 100%

title.narrative: Designated BEmONC facilities that are operational on a 24/7 basis
